module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset

-- | A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can have
--   multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or
--   associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved
--   game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is
--   synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value
--   pairs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataset</a> smart constructor.
data Dataset
Dataset' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Dataset

-- | Date when the dataset was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Number of records in this dataset.
[$sel:numRecords:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Integer

-- | Total size in bytes of the records in this dataset.
[$sel:dataStorage:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Integer

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
[$sel:datasetName:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Text

-- | Date on which the dataset was created.
[$sel:creationDate:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The device that made the last change to this dataset.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Dataset</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_lastModifiedDate</a>
--   - Date when the dataset was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRecords:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_numRecords</a> - Number of
--   records in this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataStorage:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_dataStorage</a> - Total
--   size in bytes of the records in this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_datasetName</a> - A
--   string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9,
--   '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_creationDate</a> - Date
--   on which the dataset was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_lastModifiedBy</a> -
--   The device that made the last change to this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_identityId</a> - A
--   name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
newDataset :: Dataset

-- | Date when the dataset was last modified.
dataset_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Number of records in this dataset.
dataset_numRecords :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Integer)

-- | Total size in bytes of the records in this dataset.
dataset_dataStorage :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Integer)

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
dataset_datasetName :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | Date on which the dataset was created.
dataset_creationDate :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The device that made the last change to this dataset.
dataset_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
dataset_identityId :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset.Dataset
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset.Dataset
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset.Dataset
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset.Dataset
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset.Dataset
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset.Dataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Dataset.Dataset


module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.IdentityPoolUsage

-- | Usage information for the identity pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityPoolUsage</a> smart constructor.
data IdentityPoolUsage
IdentityPoolUsage' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> IdentityPoolUsage

-- | Date on which the identity pool was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:IdentityPoolUsage'] :: IdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

-- | Data storage information for the identity pool.
[$sel:dataStorage:IdentityPoolUsage'] :: IdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe Integer

-- | Number of sync sessions for the identity pool.
[$sel:syncSessionsCount:IdentityPoolUsage'] :: IdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe Integer

module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.IdentityUsage

-- | Usage information for the identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityUsage</a> smart constructor.
data IdentityUsage
IdentityUsage' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> IdentityUsage

-- | Date on which the identity was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:IdentityUsage'] :: IdentityUsage -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,

--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

-- | Number of datasets for the identity.
[$sel:datasetCount:IdentityUsage'] :: IdentityUsage -> Maybe Int

module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.PushSync

-- | Configuration options to be applied to the identity pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushSync</a> smart constructor.
data PushSync
PushSync' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> PushSync

-- | List of SNS platform application ARNs that could be used by clients.
[$sel:applicationArns:PushSync'] :: PushSync -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A role configured to allow Cognito to call SNS on behalf of the
--   developer.
[$sel:roleArn:PushSync'] :: PushSync -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PushSync</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationArns:PushSync'</a>, <a>pushSync_applicationArns</a>
--   - List of SNS platform application ARNs that could be used by clients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:PushSync'</a>, <a>pushSync_roleArn</a> - A role
--   configured to allow Cognito to call SNS on behalf of the developer.
newPushSync :: PushSync

-- | List of SNS platform application ARNs that could be used by clients.
pushSync_applicationArns :: Lens' PushSync (Maybe [Text])

-- | A role configured to allow Cognito to call SNS on behalf of the
--   developer.
pushSync_roleArn :: Lens' PushSync (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.PushSync.PushSync
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.PushSync.PushSync

module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record

-- | The basic data structure of a dataset.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecord</a> smart constructor.
data Record
Record' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Record

-- | The server sync count for this record.
[$sel:syncCount:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Integer

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
[$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date on which the record was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The value for the record.
[$sel:value:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | The key for the record.
[$sel:key:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | The user/device that made the last change to this record.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Record</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncCount:Record'</a>, <a>record_syncCount</a> - The server
--   sync count for this record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:Record'</a>,
--   <a>record_deviceLastModifiedDate</a> - The last modified date of the
--   client device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:Record'</a>, <a>record_lastModifiedDate</a> -
--   The date on which the record was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Record'</a>, <a>record_value</a> - The value for the
--   record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Record'</a>, <a>record_key</a> - The key for the record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:Record'</a>, <a>record_lastModifiedBy</a> - The
--   user/device that made the last change to this record.
newRecord :: Record

-- | The server sync count for this record.
record_syncCount :: Lens' Record (Maybe Integer)

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
record_deviceLastModifiedDate :: Lens' Record (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date on which the record was last modified.
record_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' Record (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value for the record.
record_value :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | The key for the record.
record_key :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | The user/device that made the last change to this record.
record_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record.Record
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record.Record
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record.Record
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record.Record
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.Record.Record


module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch

-- | An update operation for a record.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordPatch</a> smart constructor.
data RecordPatch
RecordPatch' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Operation -> Text -> Integer -> RecordPatch

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
[$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The value associated with the record patch.
[$sel:value:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Maybe Text

-- | An operation, either replace or remove.
[$sel:op:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Operation

-- | The key associated with the record patch.
[$sel:key:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Text

-- | Last known server sync count for this record. Set to 0 if unknown.
[$sel:syncCount:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>RecordPatch</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:RecordPatch'</a>,
--   <a>recordPatch_deviceLastModifiedDate</a> - The last modified date of
--   the client device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_value</a> - The value
--   associated with the record patch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:op:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_op</a> - An operation,
--   either replace or remove.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_key</a> - The key
--   associated with the record patch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncCount:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_syncCount</a> -
--   Last known server sync count for this record. Set to 0 if unknown.
newRecordPatch :: Operation -> Text -> Integer -> RecordPatch

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
recordPatch_deviceLastModifiedDate :: Lens' RecordPatch (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value associated with the record patch.
recordPatch_value :: Lens' RecordPatch (Maybe Text)

-- | An operation, either replace or remove.
recordPatch_op :: Lens' RecordPatch Operation

-- | The key associated with the record patch.
recordPatch_key :: Lens' RecordPatch Text

-- | Last known server sync count for this record. Set to 0 if unknown.
recordPatch_syncCount :: Lens' RecordPatch Integer
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch.RecordPatch
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch.RecordPatch
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch.RecordPatch
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch.RecordPatch
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch.RecordPatch
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch.RecordPatch
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.RecordPatch.RecordPatch


module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus
newtype StreamingStatus
StreamingStatus' :: Text -> StreamingStatus
[fromStreamingStatus] :: StreamingStatus -> Text
pattern StreamingStatus_DISABLED :: StreamingStatus
pattern StreamingStatus_ENABLED :: StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.StreamingStatus.StreamingStatus


module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams

-- | Configuration options for configure Cognito streams.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCognitoStreams</a> smart constructor.
data CognitoStreams
CognitoStreams' :: Maybe StreamingStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CognitoStreams

-- | Status of the Cognito streams. Valid values are:
--   
--   ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
--   
--   DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk
--   publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.
[$sel:streamingStatus:CognitoStreams'] :: CognitoStreams -> Maybe StreamingStatus

-- | The name of the Cognito stream to receive updates. This stream must be
--   in the developers account and in the same region as the identity pool.
[$sel:streamName:CognitoStreams'] :: CognitoStreams -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to
--   the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito
--   (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.
[$sel:roleArn:CognitoStreams'] :: CognitoStreams -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CognitoStreams</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamingStatus:CognitoStreams'</a>,
--   <a>cognitoStreams_streamingStatus</a> - Status of the Cognito streams.
--   Valid values are:
--   
--   ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
--   
--   DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk
--   publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:CognitoStreams'</a>,
--   <a>cognitoStreams_streamName</a> - The name of the Cognito stream to
--   receive updates. This stream must be in the developers account and in
--   the same region as the identity pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CognitoStreams'</a>, <a>cognitoStreams_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to
--   the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito
--   (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.
newCognitoStreams :: CognitoStreams

-- | Status of the Cognito streams. Valid values are:
--   
--   ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
--   
--   DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk
--   publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.
cognitoStreams_streamingStatus :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe StreamingStatus)

-- | The name of the Cognito stream to receive updates. This stream must be
--   in the developers account and in the same region as the identity pool.
cognitoStreams_streamName :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to
--   the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito
--   (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.
cognitoStreams_roleArn :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types.CognitoStreams.CognitoStreams


module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Types

-- | API version <tt>2014-06-30</tt> of the Amazon Cognito Sync SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Thrown when a request parameter does not comply with the associated
--   constraints.
_InvalidParameterException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown when a user is not authorized to access the requested resource.
_NotAuthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Indicates an internal service error.
_InternalErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Prism for InvalidConfigurationException' errors.
_InvalidConfigurationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An exception thrown when there is an IN_PROGRESS bulk publish
--   operation for the given identity pool.
_DuplicateRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS Lambda throttled your account, please contact AWS Support
_LambdaThrottledException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An exception thrown when a bulk publish operation is requested less
--   than 24 hours after a previous bulk publish operation completed
--   successfully.
_AlreadyStreamedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The AWS Lambda function returned invalid output or an exception.
_InvalidLambdaFunctionOutputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if the request is throttled.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if there are parallel requests to modify a resource.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if an update can't be applied because the resource was changed
--   by another call and this would result in a conflict.
_ResourceConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if the resource doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown when the limit on the number of objects or operations has been
--   exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype BulkPublishStatus
BulkPublishStatus' :: Text -> BulkPublishStatus
[fromBulkPublishStatus] :: BulkPublishStatus -> Text
pattern BulkPublishStatus_FAILED :: BulkPublishStatus
pattern BulkPublishStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: BulkPublishStatus
pattern BulkPublishStatus_NOT_STARTED :: BulkPublishStatus
pattern BulkPublishStatus_SUCCEEDED :: BulkPublishStatus
newtype Operation
Operation' :: Text -> Operation
[fromOperation] :: Operation -> Text
pattern Operation_Remove :: Operation
pattern Operation_Replace :: Operation
newtype Platform
Platform' :: Text -> Platform
[fromPlatform] :: Platform -> Text
pattern Platform_ADM :: Platform
pattern Platform_APNS :: Platform
pattern Platform_APNS_SANDBOX :: Platform
pattern Platform_GCM :: Platform
newtype StreamingStatus
StreamingStatus' :: Text -> StreamingStatus
[fromStreamingStatus] :: StreamingStatus -> Text
pattern StreamingStatus_DISABLED :: StreamingStatus
pattern StreamingStatus_ENABLED :: StreamingStatus

-- | Configuration options for configure Cognito streams.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCognitoStreams</a> smart constructor.
data CognitoStreams
CognitoStreams' :: Maybe StreamingStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CognitoStreams

-- | Status of the Cognito streams. Valid values are:
--   
--   ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
--   
--   DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk
--   publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.
[$sel:streamingStatus:CognitoStreams'] :: CognitoStreams -> Maybe StreamingStatus

-- | The name of the Cognito stream to receive updates. This stream must be
--   in the developers account and in the same region as the identity pool.
[$sel:streamName:CognitoStreams'] :: CognitoStreams -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to
--   the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito
--   (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.
[$sel:roleArn:CognitoStreams'] :: CognitoStreams -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CognitoStreams</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamingStatus:CognitoStreams'</a>,
--   <a>cognitoStreams_streamingStatus</a> - Status of the Cognito streams.
--   Valid values are:
--   
--   ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
--   
--   DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk
--   publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamName:CognitoStreams'</a>,
--   <a>cognitoStreams_streamName</a> - The name of the Cognito stream to
--   receive updates. This stream must be in the developers account and in
--   the same region as the identity pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CognitoStreams'</a>, <a>cognitoStreams_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to
--   the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito
--   (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.
newCognitoStreams :: CognitoStreams

-- | Status of the Cognito streams. Valid values are:
--   
--   ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
--   
--   DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk
--   publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.
cognitoStreams_streamingStatus :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe StreamingStatus)

-- | The name of the Cognito stream to receive updates. This stream must be
--   in the developers account and in the same region as the identity pool.
cognitoStreams_streamName :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to
--   the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito
--   (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.
cognitoStreams_roleArn :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe Text)

-- | A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can have
--   multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or
--   associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved
--   game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is
--   synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value
--   pairs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataset</a> smart constructor.
data Dataset
Dataset' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Dataset

-- | Date when the dataset was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Number of records in this dataset.
[$sel:numRecords:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Integer

-- | Total size in bytes of the records in this dataset.
[$sel:dataStorage:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Integer

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
[$sel:datasetName:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Text

-- | Date on which the dataset was created.
[$sel:creationDate:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The device that made the last change to this dataset.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:Dataset'] :: Dataset -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Dataset</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_lastModifiedDate</a>
--   - Date when the dataset was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numRecords:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_numRecords</a> - Number of
--   records in this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataStorage:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_dataStorage</a> - Total
--   size in bytes of the records in this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_datasetName</a> - A
--   string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9,
--   '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_creationDate</a> - Date
--   on which the dataset was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_lastModifiedBy</a> -
--   The device that made the last change to this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:Dataset'</a>, <a>dataset_identityId</a> - A
--   name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
newDataset :: Dataset

-- | Date when the dataset was last modified.
dataset_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Number of records in this dataset.
dataset_numRecords :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Integer)

-- | Total size in bytes of the records in this dataset.
dataset_dataStorage :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Integer)

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
dataset_datasetName :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | Date on which the dataset was created.
dataset_creationDate :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The device that made the last change to this dataset.
dataset_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
dataset_identityId :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | Usage information for the identity pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityPoolUsage</a> smart constructor.
data IdentityPoolUsage
IdentityPoolUsage' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> IdentityPoolUsage

-- | Date on which the identity pool was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:IdentityPoolUsage'] :: IdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:IdentityPoolUsage'] :: IdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe Text

-- | Data storage information for the identity pool.
[$sel:dataStorage:IdentityPoolUsage'] :: IdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe Integer

-- | Number of sync sessions for the identity pool.
[$sel:syncSessionsCount:IdentityPoolUsage'] :: IdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>IdentityPoolUsage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:IdentityPoolUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityPoolUsage_lastModifiedDate</a> - Date on which the identity
--   pool was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:IdentityPoolUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityPoolUsage_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataStorage:IdentityPoolUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityPoolUsage_dataStorage</a> - Data storage information for
--   the identity pool.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncSessionsCount:IdentityPoolUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityPoolUsage_syncSessionsCount</a> - Number of sync sessions
--   for the identity pool.
newIdentityPoolUsage :: IdentityPoolUsage

-- | Date on which the identity pool was last modified.
identityPoolUsage_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
identityPoolUsage_identityPoolId :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | Data storage information for the identity pool.
identityPoolUsage_dataStorage :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Integer)

-- | Number of sync sessions for the identity pool.
identityPoolUsage_syncSessionsCount :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Integer)

-- | Usage information for the identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityUsage</a> smart constructor.
data IdentityUsage
IdentityUsage' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> IdentityUsage

-- | Date on which the identity was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:IdentityUsage'] :: IdentityUsage -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:IdentityUsage'] :: IdentityUsage -> Maybe Text

-- | Number of datasets for the identity.
[$sel:datasetCount:IdentityUsage'] :: IdentityUsage -> Maybe Int

-- | Total data storage for this identity.
[$sel:dataStorage:IdentityUsage'] :: IdentityUsage -> Maybe Integer

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:IdentityUsage'] :: IdentityUsage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IdentityUsage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:IdentityUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityUsage_lastModifiedDate</a> - Date on which the identity was
--   last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:IdentityUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityUsage_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetCount:IdentityUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityUsage_datasetCount</a> - Number of datasets for the
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataStorage:IdentityUsage'</a>,
--   <a>identityUsage_dataStorage</a> - Total data storage for this
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:IdentityUsage'</a>, <a>identityUsage_identityId</a>
--   - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
newIdentityUsage :: IdentityUsage

-- | Date on which the identity was last modified.
identityUsage_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
identityUsage_identityPoolId :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | Number of datasets for the identity.
identityUsage_datasetCount :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Int)

-- | Total data storage for this identity.
identityUsage_dataStorage :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Integer)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
identityUsage_identityId :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | Configuration options to be applied to the identity pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPushSync</a> smart constructor.
data PushSync
PushSync' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> PushSync

-- | List of SNS platform application ARNs that could be used by clients.
[$sel:applicationArns:PushSync'] :: PushSync -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A role configured to allow Cognito to call SNS on behalf of the
--   developer.
[$sel:roleArn:PushSync'] :: PushSync -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PushSync</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationArns:PushSync'</a>, <a>pushSync_applicationArns</a>
--   - List of SNS platform application ARNs that could be used by clients.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:PushSync'</a>, <a>pushSync_roleArn</a> - A role
--   configured to allow Cognito to call SNS on behalf of the developer.
newPushSync :: PushSync

-- | List of SNS platform application ARNs that could be used by clients.
pushSync_applicationArns :: Lens' PushSync (Maybe [Text])

-- | A role configured to allow Cognito to call SNS on behalf of the
--   developer.
pushSync_roleArn :: Lens' PushSync (Maybe Text)

-- | The basic data structure of a dataset.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecord</a> smart constructor.
data Record
Record' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Record

-- | The server sync count for this record.
[$sel:syncCount:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Integer

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
[$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date on which the record was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The value for the record.
[$sel:value:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | The key for the record.
[$sel:key:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | The user/device that made the last change to this record.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:Record'] :: Record -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Record</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncCount:Record'</a>, <a>record_syncCount</a> - The server
--   sync count for this record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:Record'</a>,
--   <a>record_deviceLastModifiedDate</a> - The last modified date of the
--   client device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:Record'</a>, <a>record_lastModifiedDate</a> -
--   The date on which the record was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Record'</a>, <a>record_value</a> - The value for the
--   record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Record'</a>, <a>record_key</a> - The key for the record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:Record'</a>, <a>record_lastModifiedBy</a> - The
--   user/device that made the last change to this record.
newRecord :: Record

-- | The server sync count for this record.
record_syncCount :: Lens' Record (Maybe Integer)

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
record_deviceLastModifiedDate :: Lens' Record (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date on which the record was last modified.
record_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' Record (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value for the record.
record_value :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | The key for the record.
record_key :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | The user/device that made the last change to this record.
record_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | An update operation for a record.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordPatch</a> smart constructor.
data RecordPatch
RecordPatch' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Operation -> Text -> Integer -> RecordPatch

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
[$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The value associated with the record patch.
[$sel:value:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Maybe Text

-- | An operation, either replace or remove.
[$sel:op:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Operation

-- | The key associated with the record patch.
[$sel:key:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Text

-- | Last known server sync count for this record. Set to 0 if unknown.
[$sel:syncCount:RecordPatch'] :: RecordPatch -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>RecordPatch</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceLastModifiedDate:RecordPatch'</a>,
--   <a>recordPatch_deviceLastModifiedDate</a> - The last modified date of
--   the client device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_value</a> - The value
--   associated with the record patch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:op:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_op</a> - An operation,
--   either replace or remove.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_key</a> - The key
--   associated with the record patch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncCount:RecordPatch'</a>, <a>recordPatch_syncCount</a> -
--   Last known server sync count for this record. Set to 0 if unknown.
newRecordPatch :: Operation -> Text -> Integer -> RecordPatch

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
recordPatch_deviceLastModifiedDate :: Lens' RecordPatch (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value associated with the record patch.
recordPatch_value :: Lens' RecordPatch (Maybe Text)

-- | An operation, either replace or remove.
recordPatch_op :: Lens' RecordPatch Operation

-- | The key associated with the record patch.
recordPatch_key :: Lens' RecordPatch Text

-- | Last known server sync count for this record. Set to 0 if unknown.
recordPatch_syncCount :: Lens' RecordPatch Integer


-- | Subscribes to receive notifications when a dataset is modified by
--   another device.
--   
--   This API can only be called with temporary credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity. You cannot call this API with developer credentials.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset

-- | A request to SubscribeToDatasetRequest.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscribeToDataset</a> smart constructor.
data SubscribeToDataset
SubscribeToDataset' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SubscribeToDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. The ID of the pool to which the identity belongs.
[$sel:identityPoolId:SubscribeToDataset'] :: SubscribeToDataset -> Text

-- | Unique ID for this identity.
[$sel:identityId:SubscribeToDataset'] :: SubscribeToDataset -> Text

-- | The name of the dataset to subcribe to.
[$sel:datasetName:SubscribeToDataset'] :: SubscribeToDataset -> Text

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
[$sel:deviceId:SubscribeToDataset'] :: SubscribeToDataset -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SubscribeToDataset</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:SubscribeToDataset'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeToDataset_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. The ID of the pool to which the identity belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:SubscribeToDataset'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeToDataset_identityId</a> - Unique ID for this identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:SubscribeToDataset'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeToDataset_datasetName</a> - The name of the dataset to
--   subcribe to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceId:SubscribeToDataset'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeToDataset_deviceId</a> - The unique ID generated for this
--   device by Cognito.
newSubscribeToDataset :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SubscribeToDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. The ID of the pool to which the identity belongs.
subscribeToDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | Unique ID for this identity.
subscribeToDataset_identityId :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | The name of the dataset to subcribe to.
subscribeToDataset_datasetName :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
subscribeToDataset_deviceId :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | Response to a SubscribeToDataset request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscribeToDatasetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SubscribeToDatasetResponse
SubscribeToDatasetResponse' :: Int -> SubscribeToDatasetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SubscribeToDatasetResponse'] :: SubscribeToDatasetResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SubscribeToDatasetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SubscribeToDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeToDatasetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newSubscribeToDatasetResponse :: Int -> SubscribeToDatasetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
subscribeToDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SubscribeToDatasetResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDatasetResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SubscribeToDataset.SubscribeToDataset


-- | Sets the necessary configuration for push sync.
--   
--   This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot
--   call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito
--   Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetIdentityPoolConfiguration

-- | The input for the SetIdentityPoolConfiguration operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetIdentityPoolConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SetIdentityPoolConfiguration
SetIdentityPoolConfiguration' :: Maybe CognitoStreams -> Maybe PushSync -> Text -> SetIdentityPoolConfiguration

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
[$sel:cognitoStreams:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'] :: SetIdentityPoolConfiguration -> Maybe CognitoStreams

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
[$sel:pushSync:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'] :: SetIdentityPoolConfiguration -> Maybe PushSync

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. This is the ID of the pool to modify.
[$sel:identityPoolId:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'] :: SetIdentityPoolConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SetIdentityPoolConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cognitoStreams:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setIdentityPoolConfiguration_cognitoStreams</a> - Options to apply
--   to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pushSync:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setIdentityPoolConfiguration_pushSync</a> - Options to apply to
--   this identity pool for push synchronization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setIdentityPoolConfiguration_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced
--   GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE)
--   created by Amazon Cognito. This is the ID of the pool to modify.
newSetIdentityPoolConfiguration :: Text -> SetIdentityPoolConfiguration

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
setIdentityPoolConfiguration_cognitoStreams :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfiguration (Maybe CognitoStreams)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
setIdentityPoolConfiguration_pushSync :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfiguration (Maybe PushSync)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. This is the ID of the pool to modify.
setIdentityPoolConfiguration_identityPoolId :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfiguration Text

-- | The output for the SetIdentityPoolConfiguration operation
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse
SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CognitoStreams -> Maybe PushSync -> Int -> SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
[$sel:identityPoolId:SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
[$sel:cognitoStreams:SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Maybe CognitoStreams

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
[$sel:pushSync:SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Maybe PushSync

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_identityPoolId</a> - A
--   name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cognitoStreams:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_cognitoStreams</a> - Options
--   to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pushSync:SetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_pushSync</a> - Options to
--   apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newSetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse :: Int -> SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_cognitoStreams :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe CognitoStreams)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_pushSync :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe PushSync)

-- | The response's http status code.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse Int

-- | Sets the AWS Lambda function for a given event type for an identity
--   pool. This request only updates the key/value pair specified. Other
--   key/values pairs are not updated. To remove a key value pair, pass a
--   empty value for the particular key.
--   
--   This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot
--   call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito
--   Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents

-- | A request to configure Cognito Events"
--   
--   "
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetCognitoEvents</a> smart constructor.
data SetCognitoEvents
SetCognitoEvents' :: Text -> HashMap Text Text -> SetCognitoEvents

-- | The Cognito Identity Pool to use when configuring Cognito Events
[$sel:identityPoolId:SetCognitoEvents'] :: SetCognitoEvents -> Text

-- | The events to configure
[$sel:events:SetCognitoEvents'] :: SetCognitoEvents -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SetCognitoEvents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:SetCognitoEvents'</a>,
--   <a>setCognitoEvents_identityPoolId</a> - The Cognito Identity Pool to
--   use when configuring Cognito Events
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:SetCognitoEvents'</a>, <a>setCognitoEvents_events</a> -
--   The events to configure
newSetCognitoEvents :: Text -> SetCognitoEvents

-- | The Cognito Identity Pool to use when configuring Cognito Events
setCognitoEvents_identityPoolId :: Lens' SetCognitoEvents Text

-- | The events to configure
setCognitoEvents_events :: Lens' SetCognitoEvents (HashMap Text Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSetCognitoEventsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SetCognitoEventsResponse
SetCognitoEventsResponse' :: SetCognitoEventsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SetCognitoEventsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newSetCognitoEventsResponse :: SetCognitoEventsResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents.SetCognitoEvents
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents.SetCognitoEvents
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents.SetCognitoEvents
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents.SetCognitoEvents

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents.SetCognitoEventsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents.SetCognitoEventsResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.SetCognitoEvents.SetCognitoEvents


-- | Registers a device to receive push sync notifications.
--   
--   This API can only be called with temporary credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity. You cannot call this API with developer credentials.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice

-- | A request to RegisterDevice.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterDevice</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterDevice
RegisterDevice' :: Text -> Text -> Platform -> Text -> RegisterDevice

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. Here, the ID of the pool that the identity belongs to.
[$sel:identityPoolId:RegisterDevice'] :: RegisterDevice -> Text

-- | The unique ID for this identity.
[$sel:identityId:RegisterDevice'] :: RegisterDevice -> Text

-- | The SNS platform type (e.g. GCM, SDM, APNS, APNS_SANDBOX).
[$sel:platform:RegisterDevice'] :: RegisterDevice -> Platform

-- | The push token.
[$sel:token:RegisterDevice'] :: RegisterDevice -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterDevice</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:RegisterDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerDevice_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. Here, the ID of the pool that the identity belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:RegisterDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerDevice_identityId</a> - The unique ID for this identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:RegisterDevice'</a>, <a>registerDevice_platform</a> -
--   The SNS platform type (e.g. GCM, SDM, APNS, APNS_SANDBOX).
--   
--   <a>$sel:token:RegisterDevice'</a>, <a>registerDevice_token</a> - The
--   push token.
newRegisterDevice :: Text -> Text -> Platform -> Text -> RegisterDevice

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. Here, the ID of the pool that the identity belongs to.
registerDevice_identityPoolId :: Lens' RegisterDevice Text

-- | The unique ID for this identity.
registerDevice_identityId :: Lens' RegisterDevice Text

-- | The SNS platform type (e.g. GCM, SDM, APNS, APNS_SANDBOX).
registerDevice_platform :: Lens' RegisterDevice Platform

-- | The push token.
registerDevice_token :: Lens' RegisterDevice Text

-- | Response to a RegisterDevice request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterDeviceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterDeviceResponse
RegisterDeviceResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> RegisterDeviceResponse

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
[$sel:deviceId:RegisterDeviceResponse'] :: RegisterDeviceResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RegisterDeviceResponse'] :: RegisterDeviceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterDeviceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceId:RegisterDeviceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>registerDeviceResponse_deviceId</a> - The unique ID generated for
--   this device by Cognito.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RegisterDeviceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>registerDeviceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newRegisterDeviceResponse :: Int -> RegisterDeviceResponse

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
registerDeviceResponse_deviceId :: Lens' RegisterDeviceResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
registerDeviceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RegisterDeviceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDeviceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDeviceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDeviceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDeviceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDeviceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.RegisterDevice.RegisterDevice


-- | Gets paginated records, optionally changed after a particular sync
--   count for a dataset and identity. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each
--   identity has access only to its own data. Thus, the credentials used
--   to make this API call need to have access to the identity data.
--   
--   ListRecords can be called with temporary user credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity or with developer credentials. You should use Cognito
--   Identity credentials to make this API call.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.ListRecords

-- | A request for a list of records.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListRecords</a> smart constructor.
data ListRecords
ListRecords' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ListRecords

-- | The last server sync count for this record.
[$sel:lastSyncCount:ListRecords'] :: ListRecords -> Maybe Integer

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListRecords'] :: ListRecords -> Maybe Text

-- | A token containing a session ID, identity ID, and expiration.
[$sel:syncSessionToken:ListRecords'] :: ListRecords -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
[$sel:maxResults:ListRecords'] :: ListRecords -> Maybe Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:ListRecords'] :: ListRecords -> Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:ListRecords'] :: ListRecords -> Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
[$sel:datasetName:ListRecords'] :: ListRecords -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRecords</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSyncCount:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecords_lastSyncCount</a> - The last server sync count for this
--   record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_nextToken</a> - A
--   pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncSessionToken:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecords_syncSessionToken</a> - A token containing a session ID,
--   identity ID, and expiration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of results to be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecords_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_identityId</a> - A
--   name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_datasetName</a> -
--   A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
newListRecords :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ListRecords

-- | The last server sync count for this record.
listRecords_lastSyncCount :: Lens' ListRecords (Maybe Integer)

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
listRecords_nextToken :: Lens' ListRecords (Maybe Text)

-- | A token containing a session ID, identity ID, and expiration.

--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listRecords_identityPoolId :: Lens' ListRecords Text

--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listRecords_identityId :: Lens' ListRecords Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
listRecords_datasetName :: Lens' ListRecords Text

-- | Returned for a successful ListRecordsRequest.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListRecordsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListRecordsResponse
ListRecordsResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Record] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Int -> ListRecordsResponse

-- | A boolean value specifying whether to delete the dataset locally.
[$sel:datasetDeletedAfterRequestedSyncCount:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Indicates whether the dataset exists.
[$sel:datasetExists:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Total number of records.
[$sel:count:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | A list of all records.
[$sel:records:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe [Record]

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Names of merged datasets.
[$sel:mergedDatasetNames:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A token containing a session ID, identity ID, and expiration.
[$sel:syncSessionToken:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The user/device that made the last change to this record.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Server sync count for this dataset.
[$sel:datasetSyncCount:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListRecordsResponse'] :: ListRecordsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRecordsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetExists:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_datasetExists</a> - Indicates whether the
--   dataset exists.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_count</a> - Total number of records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:records:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_records</a> - A list of all records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_nextToken</a> - A pagination token for
--   obtaining the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mergedDatasetNames:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_mergedDatasetNames</a> - Names of merged
--   datasets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncSessionToken:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_syncSessionToken</a> - A token containing a
--   session ID, identity ID, and expiration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user/device that made
--   the last change to this record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetSyncCount:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_datasetSyncCount</a> - Server sync count for
--   this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

-- | Gets a list of identity pools registered with Cognito.
--   
--   ListIdentityPoolUsage can only be called with developer credentials.
--   You cannot make this API call with the temporary user credentials
--   provided by Cognito Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.ListIdentityPoolUsage

-- | A request for usage information on an identity pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListIdentityPoolUsage</a> smart constructor.
data ListIdentityPoolUsage
ListIdentityPoolUsage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ListIdentityPoolUsage

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListIdentityPoolUsage'] :: ListIdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
[$sel:maxResults:ListIdentityPoolUsage'] :: ListIdentityPoolUsage -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListIdentityPoolUsage</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   obtaining the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListIdentityPoolUsage'</a>,
--   <a>listIdentityPoolUsage_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   results to be returned.
newListIdentityPoolUsage :: ListIdentityPoolUsage

listIdentityPoolUsage_nextToken :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
listIdentityPoolUsage_maxResults :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Int)

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListIdentityPoolUsageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse

-- | Usage information for the identity pools.
[$sel:identityPoolUsages:ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse'] :: ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse -> Maybe [IdentityPoolUsage]

[$sel:count:ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse'] :: ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
[$sel:maxResults:ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse'] :: ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse -> Maybe Int

[$sel:httpStatus:ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse'] :: ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse -> Int

--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   identities for the identity pool.

--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListIdentityPoolUsage'</a>,
--   <a>listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_nextToken</a> - A pagination token
--   for obtaining the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListIdentityPoolUsage'</a>,
--   <a>listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_maxResults</a> - The maximum number
--   of results to be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http

listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse Int

-- | Lists datasets for an identity. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each
--   identity has access only to its own data. Thus, the credentials used
--   to make this API call need to have access to the identity data.
--   
--   ListDatasets can be called with temporary user credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity or with developer credentials. You should use the
--   Cognito Identity credentials to make this API call.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.ListDatasets

-- | Request for a list of datasets for an identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListDatasets</a> smart constructor.
data ListDatasets
ListDatasets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> ListDatasets

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListDatasets'] :: ListDatasets -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
[$sel:maxResults:ListDatasets'] :: ListDatasets -> Maybe Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:ListDatasets'] :: ListDatasets -> Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:ListDatasets'] :: ListDatasets -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListDatasets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListDatasets'</a>, <a>listDatasets_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of results to be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:ListDatasets'</a>, <a>listDatasets_identityId</a> -
--   A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:ListDatasets'</a>,
--   <a>listDatasets_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listDatasets_identityId :: Lens' ListDatasets Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listDatasets_identityPoolId :: Lens' ListDatasets Text

-- | Returned for a successful ListDatasets request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListDatasetsResponse</a> smart constructor.

[$sel:httpStatus:ListDatasetsResponse'] :: ListDatasetsResponse -> Int

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Gets the configuration settings of an identity pool.
--   
--   This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot
--   call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito
--   Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration

-- | The input for the GetIdentityPoolConfiguration operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetIdentityPoolConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data GetIdentityPoolConfiguration
GetIdentityPoolConfiguration' :: Text -> GetIdentityPoolConfiguration

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. This is the ID of the pool for which to return a
--   configuration.
[$sel:identityPoolId:GetIdentityPoolConfiguration'] :: GetIdentityPoolConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetIdentityPoolConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:GetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getIdentityPoolConfiguration_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced
--   GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE)
--   created by Amazon Cognito. This is the ID of the pool for which to
--   return a configuration.
newGetIdentityPoolConfiguration :: Text -> GetIdentityPoolConfiguration

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. This is the ID of the pool for which to return a
--   configuration.
getIdentityPoolConfiguration_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfiguration Text

-- | The output for the GetIdentityPoolConfiguration operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse
GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CognitoStreams -> Maybe PushSync -> Int -> GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
[$sel:identityPoolId:GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
[$sel:cognitoStreams:GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Maybe CognitoStreams

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
[$sel:pushSync:GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Maybe PushSync

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'] :: GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:GetIdentityPoolConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_identityPoolId</a> - A
--   name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cognitoStreams:GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_cognitoStreams</a> - Options
--   to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pushSync:GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_pushSync</a> - Options to
--   apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newGetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse :: Int -> GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_cognitoStreams :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe CognitoStreams)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_pushSync :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe PushSync)

-- | The response's http status code.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration.GetIdentityPoolConfiguration
