-- | Gets the events and the corresponding Lambda functions associated with
--   an identity pool.
--   
--   This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot
--   call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito
--   Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetCognitoEvents

-- | A request for a list of the configured Cognito Events
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetCognitoEvents</a> smart constructor.
data GetCognitoEvents
GetCognitoEvents' :: Text -> GetCognitoEvents

-- | The Cognito Identity Pool ID for the request
[$sel:identityPoolId:GetCognitoEvents'] :: GetCognitoEvents -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetCognitoEvents</a> with all optional fields

--

--   fields.

--   for the request

-- | Get the status of the last BulkPublish operation for an identity pool.
--   
--   This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot
--   call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito
--   Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetBulkPublishDetails

-- | The input for the GetBulkPublishDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBulkPublishDetails</a> smart constructor.
data GetBulkPublishDetails
GetBulkPublishDetails' :: Text -> GetBulkPublishDetails

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:GetBulkPublishDetails'] :: GetBulkPublishDetails -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBulkPublishDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:GetBulkPublishDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetails_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
newGetBulkPublishDetails :: Text -> GetBulkPublishDetails

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
getBulkPublishDetails_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetails Text

-- | The output for the GetBulkPublishDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBulkPublishDetailsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse
GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BulkPublishStatus -> Int -> GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse

-- | The date/time at which the last bulk publish was initiated.
[$sel:bulkPublishStartTime:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'] :: GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'] :: GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If BulkPublishStatus is SUCCEEDED, the time the last bulk publish
--   operation completed.
[$sel:bulkPublishCompleteTime:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'] :: GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If BulkPublishStatus is FAILED this field will contain the error
--   message that caused the bulk publish to fail.
[$sel:failureMessage:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'] :: GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Status of the last bulk publish operation, valid values are:
--   
--   NOT_STARTED - No bulk publish has been requested for this identity
--   pool
--   
--   IN_PROGRESS - Data is being published to the configured stream
--   
--   SUCCEEDED - All data for the identity pool has been published to the
--   configured stream
--   
--   FAILED - Some portion of the data has failed to publish, check
--   FailureMessage for the cause.
[$sel:bulkPublishStatus:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'] :: GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse -> Maybe BulkPublishStatus

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'] :: GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkPublishStartTime:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStartTime</a> - The
--   date/time at which the last bulk publish was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:GetBulkPublishDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced
--   GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE)
--   created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkPublishCompleteTime:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishCompleteTime</a> - If
--   BulkPublishStatus is SUCCEEDED, the time the last bulk publish
--   operation completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureMessage:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_failureMessage</a> - If
--   BulkPublishStatus is FAILED this field will contain the error message
--   that caused the bulk publish to fail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkPublishStatus:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStatus</a> - Status of the
--   last bulk publish operation, valid values are:
--   
--   NOT_STARTED - No bulk publish has been requested for this identity
--   pool
--   
--   IN_PROGRESS - Data is being published to the configured stream
--   
--   SUCCEEDED - All data for the identity pool has been published to the
--   configured stream
--   
--   FAILED - Some portion of the data has failed to publish, check
--   FailureMessage for the cause.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetBulkPublishDetailsResponse :: Int -> GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse

-- | The date/time at which the last bulk publish was initiated.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStartTime :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If BulkPublishStatus is SUCCEEDED, the time the last bulk publish
--   operation completed.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishCompleteTime :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If BulkPublishStatus is FAILED this field will contain the error
--   message that caused the bulk publish to fail.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_failureMessage :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Status of the last bulk publish operation, valid values are:
--   
--   NOT_STARTED - No bulk publish has been requested for this identity
--   pool
--   
--   IN_PROGRESS - Data is being published to the configured stream
--   
--   SUCCEEDED - All data for the identity pool has been published to the
--   configured stream
--   
--   FAILED - Some portion of the data has failed to publish, check
--   FailureMessage for the cause.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStatus :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe BulkPublishStatus)

-- | The response's http status code.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetBulkPublishDetails.GetBulkPublishDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetBulkPublishDetails.GetBulkPublishDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.GetBulkPublishDetails.GetBulkPublishDetails

-- | Gets usage information for an identity, including number of datasets
--   and data usage.
--   
--   This API can be called with temporary user credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity or with developer credentials.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeIdentityUsage

-- | A request for information about the usage of an identity pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeIdentityUsage</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeIdentityUsage
DescribeIdentityUsage' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeIdentityUsage

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:DescribeIdentityUsage'] :: DescribeIdentityUsage -> Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

--   Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeIdentityUsage_identityPoolId :: Lens' DescribeIdentityUsage Text

--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

--   status code.

-- | Gets usage details (for example, data storage) about a particular
--   identity pool.
--   
--   This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot
--   call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito
--   Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeIdentityPoolUsage

-- | A request for usage information about the identity pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeIdentityPoolUsage</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeIdentityPoolUsage

--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:DescribeIdentityPoolUsage'] :: DescribeIdentityPoolUsage -> Text

--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.

--   constructor.

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeIdentityPoolUsage.DescribeIdentityPoolUsage


-- | Gets meta data about a dataset by identity and dataset name. With
--   Amazon Cognito Sync, each identity has access only to its own data.
--   Thus, the credentials used to make this API call need to have access
--   to the identity data.
--   
--   This API can be called with temporary user credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity or with developer credentials. You should use Cognito
--   Identity credentials to make this API call.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset

-- | A request for meta data about a dataset (creation date, number of
--   records, size) by owner and dataset name.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDataset</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDataset
DescribeDataset' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:DescribeDataset'] :: DescribeDataset -> Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:DescribeDataset'] :: DescribeDataset -> Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
[$sel:datasetName:DescribeDataset'] :: DescribeDataset -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDataset</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:DescribeDataset'</a>,
--   <a>describeDataset_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:DescribeDataset'</a>,
--   <a>describeDataset_identityId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:DescribeDataset'</a>,
--   <a>describeDataset_datasetName</a> - A string of up to 128 characters.
--   Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash),
--   and '.' (dot).
newDescribeDataset :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' DescribeDataset Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeDataset_identityId :: Lens' DescribeDataset Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
describeDataset_datasetName :: Lens' DescribeDataset Text

-- | Response to a successful DescribeDataset request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDatasetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDatasetResponse
DescribeDatasetResponse' :: Maybe Dataset -> Int -> DescribeDatasetResponse

-- | Meta data for a collection of data for an identity. An identity can
--   have multiple datasets. A dataset can be general or associated with a
--   particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are
--   automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset,
--   and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value pairs.
[$sel:dataset:DescribeDatasetResponse'] :: DescribeDatasetResponse -> Maybe Dataset

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeDatasetResponse'] :: DescribeDatasetResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDatasetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataset:DescribeDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDatasetResponse_dataset</a> - Meta data for a collection of
--   data for an identity. An identity can have multiple datasets. A
--   dataset can be general or associated with a particular entity in an
--   application (like a saved game). Datasets are automatically created if
--   they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up
--   to 1MB of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDatasetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeDatasetResponse :: Int -> DescribeDatasetResponse

-- | Meta data for a collection of data for an identity. An identity can
--   have multiple datasets. A dataset can be general or associated with a
--   particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are
--   automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset,
--   and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value pairs.
describeDatasetResponse_dataset :: Lens' DescribeDatasetResponse (Maybe Dataset)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeDatasetResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDatasetResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDatasetResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DescribeDataset.DescribeDataset


-- | Deletes the specific dataset. The dataset will be deleted permanently,
--   and the action can't be undone. Datasets that this dataset was merged
--   with will no longer report the merge. Any subsequent operation on this
--   dataset will result in a ResourceNotFoundException.
--   
--   This API can be called with temporary user credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity or with developer credentials.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset

-- | A request to delete the specific dataset.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteDataset</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteDataset
DeleteDataset' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DeleteDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:DeleteDataset'] :: DeleteDataset -> Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:DeleteDataset'] :: DeleteDataset -> Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
[$sel:datasetName:DeleteDataset'] :: DeleteDataset -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteDataset</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:DeleteDataset'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDataset_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:DeleteDataset'</a>, <a>deleteDataset_identityId</a>
--   - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:DeleteDataset'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDataset_datasetName</a> - A string of up to 128 characters.
--   Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash),
--   and '.' (dot).
newDeleteDataset :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DeleteDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
deleteDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' DeleteDataset Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
deleteDataset_identityId :: Lens' DeleteDataset Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
deleteDataset_datasetName :: Lens' DeleteDataset Text

-- | Response to a successful DeleteDataset request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteDatasetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteDatasetResponse
DeleteDatasetResponse' :: Maybe Dataset -> Int -> DeleteDatasetResponse

-- | A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can have
--   multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or
--   associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved
--   game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is
--   synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value
--   pairs.
[$sel:dataset:DeleteDatasetResponse'] :: DeleteDatasetResponse -> Maybe Dataset

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteDatasetResponse'] :: DeleteDatasetResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteDatasetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataset:DeleteDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDatasetResponse_dataset</a> - A collection of data for an
--   identity pool. An identity pool can have multiple datasets. A dataset
--   is per identity and can be general or associated with a particular
--   entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are
--   automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset,
--   and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDatasetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDeleteDatasetResponse :: Int -> DeleteDatasetResponse

-- | A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can have
--   multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or
--   associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved
--   game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is
--   synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value
--   pairs.
deleteDatasetResponse_dataset :: Lens' DeleteDatasetResponse (Maybe Dataset)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteDatasetResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDatasetResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDatasetResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.DeleteDataset.DeleteDataset


-- | Initiates a bulk publish of all existing datasets for an Identity Pool
--   to the configured stream. Customers are limited to one successful bulk
--   publish per 24 hours. Bulk publish is an asynchronous request,
--   customers can see the status of the request via the
--   GetBulkPublishDetails operation.
--   
--   This API can only be called with developer credentials. You cannot
--   call this API with the temporary user credentials provided by Cognito
--   Identity.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish

-- | The input for the BulkPublish operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkPublish</a> smart constructor.
data BulkPublish
BulkPublish' :: Text -> BulkPublish

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:BulkPublish'] :: BulkPublish -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkPublish</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:BulkPublish'</a>,
--   <a>bulkPublish_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
newBulkPublish :: Text -> BulkPublish

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
bulkPublish_identityPoolId :: Lens' BulkPublish Text

-- | The output for the BulkPublish operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkPublishResponse</a> smart constructor.
data BulkPublishResponse
BulkPublishResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> BulkPublishResponse

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:BulkPublishResponse'] :: BulkPublishResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:BulkPublishResponse'] :: BulkPublishResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkPublishResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:BulkPublish'</a>,
--   <a>bulkPublishResponse_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:BulkPublishResponse'</a>,
--   <a>bulkPublishResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newBulkPublishResponse :: Int -> BulkPublishResponse

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
bulkPublishResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' BulkPublishResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
bulkPublishResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' BulkPublishResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublishResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublishResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublishResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublishResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublishResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.BulkPublish.BulkPublish


-- | Unsubscribes from receiving notifications when a dataset is modified
--   by another device.
--   
--   This API can only be called with temporary credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity. You cannot call this API with developer credentials.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset

-- | A request to UnsubscribeFromDataset.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribeFromDataset</a> smart constructor.
data UnsubscribeFromDataset
UnsubscribeFromDataset' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UnsubscribeFromDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. The ID of the pool to which this identity belongs.
[$sel:identityPoolId:UnsubscribeFromDataset'] :: UnsubscribeFromDataset -> Text

-- | Unique ID for this identity.
[$sel:identityId:UnsubscribeFromDataset'] :: UnsubscribeFromDataset -> Text

-- | The name of the dataset from which to unsubcribe.
[$sel:datasetName:UnsubscribeFromDataset'] :: UnsubscribeFromDataset -> Text

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
[$sel:deviceId:UnsubscribeFromDataset'] :: UnsubscribeFromDataset -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UnsubscribeFromDataset</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:UnsubscribeFromDataset'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromDataset_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. The ID of the pool to which this identity belongs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:UnsubscribeFromDataset'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromDataset_identityId</a> - Unique ID for this
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:UnsubscribeFromDataset'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromDataset_datasetName</a> - The name of the dataset
--   from which to unsubcribe.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceId:UnsubscribeFromDataset'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromDataset_deviceId</a> - The unique ID generated for
--   this device by Cognito.
newUnsubscribeFromDataset :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UnsubscribeFromDataset

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. The ID of the pool to which this identity belongs.
unsubscribeFromDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | Unique ID for this identity.
unsubscribeFromDataset_identityId :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | The name of the dataset from which to unsubcribe.
unsubscribeFromDataset_datasetName :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
unsubscribeFromDataset_deviceId :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | Response to an UnsubscribeFromDataset request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse
UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse' :: Int -> UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse'] :: UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromDatasetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newUnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse :: Int -> UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
unsubscribeFromDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UnsubscribeFromDataset.UnsubscribeFromDataset


-- | Posts updates to records and adds and deletes records for a dataset
--   and user.
--   
--   The sync count in the record patch is your last known sync count for
--   that record. The server will reject an UpdateRecords request with a
--   ResourceConflictException if you try to patch a record with a new
--   value but a stale sync count.
--   
--   For example, if the sync count on the server is 5 for a key called
--   highScore and you try and submit a new highScore with sync count of 4,
--   the request will be rejected. To obtain the current sync count for a
--   record, call ListRecords. On a successful update of the record, the
--   response returns the new sync count for that record. You should
--   present that sync count the next time you try to update that same
--   record. When the record does not exist, specify the sync count as 0.
--   
--   This API can be called with temporary user credentials provided by
--   Cognito Identity or with developer credentials.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords

-- | A request to post updates to records or add and delete records for a
--   dataset and user.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRecords</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRecords
UpdateRecords' :: Maybe [RecordPatch] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateRecords

-- | A list of patch operations.
[$sel:recordPatches:UpdateRecords'] :: UpdateRecords -> Maybe [RecordPatch]

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
[$sel:deviceId:UpdateRecords'] :: UpdateRecords -> Maybe Text

-- | Intended to supply a device ID that will populate the lastModifiedBy
--   field referenced in other methods. The ClientContext field is not yet
--   implemented.
[$sel:clientContext:UpdateRecords'] :: UpdateRecords -> Maybe Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityPoolId:UpdateRecords'] :: UpdateRecords -> Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
[$sel:identityId:UpdateRecords'] :: UpdateRecords -> Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
[$sel:datasetName:UpdateRecords'] :: UpdateRecords -> Text

-- | The SyncSessionToken returned by a previous call to ListRecords for
--   this dataset and identity.
[$sel:syncSessionToken:UpdateRecords'] :: UpdateRecords -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRecords</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordPatches:UpdateRecords'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecords_recordPatches</a> - A list of patch operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceId:UpdateRecords'</a>, <a>updateRecords_deviceId</a> -
--   The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientContext:UpdateRecords'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecords_clientContext</a> - Intended to supply a device ID
--   that will populate the lastModifiedBy field referenced in other
--   methods. The ClientContext field is not yet implemented.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:UpdateRecords'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecords_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:UpdateRecords'</a>, <a>updateRecords_identityId</a>
--   - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:UpdateRecords'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecords_datasetName</a> - A string of up to 128 characters.
--   Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash),
--   and '.' (dot).
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncSessionToken:UpdateRecords'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecords_syncSessionToken</a> - The SyncSessionToken returned
--   by a previous call to ListRecords for this dataset and identity.
newUpdateRecords :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateRecords

-- | A list of patch operations.
updateRecords_recordPatches :: Lens' UpdateRecords (Maybe [RecordPatch])

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
updateRecords_deviceId :: Lens' UpdateRecords (Maybe Text)

-- | Intended to supply a device ID that will populate the lastModifiedBy
--   field referenced in other methods. The ClientContext field is not yet
--   implemented.
updateRecords_clientContext :: Lens' UpdateRecords (Maybe Text)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
updateRecords_identityPoolId :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
updateRecords_identityId :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
updateRecords_datasetName :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | The SyncSessionToken returned by a previous call to ListRecords for
--   this dataset and identity.
updateRecords_syncSessionToken :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | Returned for a successful UpdateRecordsRequest.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRecordsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRecordsResponse
UpdateRecordsResponse' :: Maybe [Record] -> Int -> UpdateRecordsResponse

-- | A list of records that have been updated.
[$sel:records:UpdateRecordsResponse'] :: UpdateRecordsResponse -> Maybe [Record]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateRecordsResponse'] :: UpdateRecordsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRecordsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:records:UpdateRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecordsResponse_records</a> - A list of records that have
--   been updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecordsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateRecordsResponse :: Int -> UpdateRecordsResponse

-- | A list of records that have been updated.
updateRecordsResponse_records :: Lens' UpdateRecordsResponse (Maybe [Record])

-- | The response's http status code.
updateRecordsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateRecordsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecordsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecordsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecordsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecordsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecordsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CognitoSync.UpdateRecords.UpdateRecords


module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Lens

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' DescribeDataset Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeDataset_identityId :: Lens' DescribeDataset Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
describeDataset_datasetName :: Lens' DescribeDataset Text

-- | Meta data for a collection of data for an identity. An identity can
--   have multiple datasets. A dataset can be general or associated with a
--   particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are
--   automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset,
--   and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value pairs.
describeDatasetResponse_dataset :: Lens' DescribeDatasetResponse (Maybe Dataset)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeDatasetResponse Int

-- | The Cognito Identity Pool to use when configuring Cognito Events
setCognitoEvents_identityPoolId :: Lens' SetCognitoEvents Text

-- | The events to configure
setCognitoEvents_events :: Lens' SetCognitoEvents (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeIdentityPoolUsage_identityPoolId :: Lens' DescribeIdentityPoolUsage Text

-- | Information about the usage of the identity pool.
describeIdentityPoolUsageResponse_identityPoolUsage :: Lens' DescribeIdentityPoolUsageResponse (Maybe IdentityPoolUsage)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeIdentityPoolUsageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeIdentityPoolUsageResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
getBulkPublishDetails_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetails Text

-- | The date/time at which the last bulk publish was initiated.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStartTime :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If BulkPublishStatus is SUCCEEDED, the time the last bulk publish
--   operation completed.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishCompleteTime :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If BulkPublishStatus is FAILED this field will contain the error
--   message that caused the bulk publish to fail.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_failureMessage :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Status of the last bulk publish operation, valid values are:
--   
--   NOT_STARTED - No bulk publish has been requested for this identity
--   pool
--   
--   IN_PROGRESS - Data is being published to the configured stream
--   
--   SUCCEEDED - All data for the identity pool has been published to the
--   configured stream
--   
--   FAILED - Some portion of the data has failed to publish, check
--   FailureMessage for the cause.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStatus :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse (Maybe BulkPublishStatus)

-- | The response's http status code.
getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse Int

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
listIdentityPoolUsage_nextToken :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
listIdentityPoolUsage_maxResults :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Int)

-- | Usage information for the identity pools.
listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_identityPoolUsages :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse (Maybe [IdentityPoolUsage])

-- | Total number of identities for the identity pool.
listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_count :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_maxResults :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The response's http status code.
listIdentityPoolUsageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListIdentityPoolUsageResponse Int

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
setIdentityPoolConfiguration_cognitoStreams :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfiguration (Maybe CognitoStreams)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
setIdentityPoolConfiguration_pushSync :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfiguration (Maybe PushSync)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. This is the ID of the pool to modify.
setIdentityPoolConfiguration_identityPoolId :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfiguration Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_cognitoStreams :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe CognitoStreams)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_pushSync :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe PushSync)

-- | The response's http status code.
setIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
deleteDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' DeleteDataset Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
deleteDataset_identityId :: Lens' DeleteDataset Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
deleteDataset_datasetName :: Lens' DeleteDataset Text

-- | A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can have
--   multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or
--   associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved
--   game). Datasets are automatically created if they don't exist. Data is
--   synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value
--   pairs.
deleteDatasetResponse_dataset :: Lens' DeleteDatasetResponse (Maybe Dataset)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteDatasetResponse Int

-- | The Cognito Identity Pool ID for the request
getCognitoEvents_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetCognitoEvents Text

-- | The Cognito Events returned from the GetCognitoEvents request
getCognitoEventsResponse_events :: Lens' GetCognitoEventsResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
getCognitoEventsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetCognitoEventsResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeIdentityUsage_identityPoolId :: Lens' DescribeIdentityUsage Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
describeIdentityUsage_identityId :: Lens' DescribeIdentityUsage Text

-- | Usage information for the identity.
describeIdentityUsageResponse_identityUsage :: Lens' DescribeIdentityUsageResponse (Maybe IdentityUsage)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeIdentityUsageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeIdentityUsageResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. Here, the ID of the pool that the identity belongs to.
registerDevice_identityPoolId :: Lens' RegisterDevice Text

-- | The unique ID for this identity.
registerDevice_identityId :: Lens' RegisterDevice Text

-- | The SNS platform type (e.g. GCM, SDM, APNS, APNS_SANDBOX).
registerDevice_platform :: Lens' RegisterDevice Platform

-- | The push token.
registerDevice_token :: Lens' RegisterDevice Text

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
registerDeviceResponse_deviceId :: Lens' RegisterDeviceResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
registerDeviceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RegisterDeviceResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. The ID of the pool to which the identity belongs.
subscribeToDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | Unique ID for this identity.
subscribeToDataset_identityId :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | The name of the dataset to subcribe to.
subscribeToDataset_datasetName :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
subscribeToDataset_deviceId :: Lens' SubscribeToDataset Text

-- | The response's http status code.
subscribeToDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SubscribeToDatasetResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. This is the ID of the pool for which to return a
--   configuration.
getIdentityPoolConfiguration_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfiguration Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for Amazon Cognito streams.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_cognitoStreams :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe CognitoStreams)

-- | Options to apply to this identity pool for push synchronization.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_pushSync :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse (Maybe PushSync)

-- | The response's http status code.
getIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetIdentityPoolConfigurationResponse Int

-- | The last server sync count for this record.
listRecords_lastSyncCount :: Lens' ListRecords (Maybe Integer)

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
listRecords_nextToken :: Lens' ListRecords (Maybe Text)

-- | A token containing a session ID, identity ID, and expiration.
listRecords_syncSessionToken :: Lens' ListRecords (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
listRecords_maxResults :: Lens' ListRecords (Maybe Int)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listRecords_identityPoolId :: Lens' ListRecords Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listRecords_identityId :: Lens' ListRecords Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
listRecords_datasetName :: Lens' ListRecords Text

-- | A boolean value specifying whether to delete the dataset locally.
listRecordsResponse_datasetDeletedAfterRequestedSyncCount :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Indicates whether the dataset exists.
listRecordsResponse_datasetExists :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Total number of records.
listRecordsResponse_count :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | A list of all records.
listRecordsResponse_records :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe [Record])

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
listRecordsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Names of merged datasets.
listRecordsResponse_mergedDatasetNames :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | A token containing a session ID, identity ID, and expiration.
listRecordsResponse_syncSessionToken :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The user/device that made the last change to this record.
listRecordsResponse_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Server sync count for this dataset.
listRecordsResponse_datasetSyncCount :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The response's http status code.
listRecordsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListRecordsResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. The ID of the pool to which this identity belongs.
unsubscribeFromDataset_identityPoolId :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | Unique ID for this identity.
unsubscribeFromDataset_identityId :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | The name of the dataset from which to unsubcribe.
unsubscribeFromDataset_datasetName :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
unsubscribeFromDataset_deviceId :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDataset Text

-- | The response's http status code.
unsubscribeFromDatasetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromDatasetResponse Int

-- | A list of patch operations.
updateRecords_recordPatches :: Lens' UpdateRecords (Maybe [RecordPatch])

-- | The unique ID generated for this device by Cognito.
updateRecords_deviceId :: Lens' UpdateRecords (Maybe Text)

-- | Intended to supply a device ID that will populate the lastModifiedBy
--   field referenced in other methods. The ClientContext field is not yet
--   implemented.
updateRecords_clientContext :: Lens' UpdateRecords (Maybe Text)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
updateRecords_identityPoolId :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
updateRecords_identityId :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
updateRecords_datasetName :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | The SyncSessionToken returned by a previous call to ListRecords for
--   this dataset and identity.
updateRecords_syncSessionToken :: Lens' UpdateRecords Text

-- | A list of records that have been updated.
updateRecordsResponse_records :: Lens' UpdateRecordsResponse (Maybe [Record])

-- | The response's http status code.
updateRecordsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateRecordsResponse Int

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
listDatasets_nextToken :: Lens' ListDatasets (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned.
listDatasets_maxResults :: Lens' ListDatasets (Maybe Int)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listDatasets_identityId :: Lens' ListDatasets Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
listDatasets_identityPoolId :: Lens' ListDatasets Text

-- | Number of datasets returned.
listDatasetsResponse_count :: Lens' ListDatasetsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | A pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
listDatasetsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListDatasetsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A set of datasets.
listDatasetsResponse_datasets :: Lens' ListDatasetsResponse (Maybe [Dataset])

-- | The response's http status code.
listDatasetsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListDatasetsResponse Int

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
bulkPublish_identityPoolId :: Lens' BulkPublish Text

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
bulkPublishResponse_identityPoolId :: Lens' BulkPublishResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
bulkPublishResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' BulkPublishResponse Int

-- | Status of the Cognito streams. Valid values are:
--   
--   ENABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is enabled.
--   
--   DISABLED - Streaming of updates to identity pool is disabled. Bulk
--   publish will also fail if StreamingStatus is DISABLED.
cognitoStreams_streamingStatus :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe StreamingStatus)

-- | The name of the Cognito stream to receive updates. This stream must be
--   in the developers account and in the same region as the identity pool.
cognitoStreams_streamName :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role Amazon Cognito can assume in order to publish to
--   the stream. This role must grant access to Amazon Cognito
--   (cognito-sync) to invoke PutRecord on your Cognito stream.
cognitoStreams_roleArn :: Lens' CognitoStreams (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when the dataset was last modified.
dataset_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Number of records in this dataset.
dataset_numRecords :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Integer)

-- | Total size in bytes of the records in this dataset.
dataset_dataStorage :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Integer)

-- | A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
dataset_datasetName :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | Date on which the dataset was created.
dataset_creationDate :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The device that made the last change to this dataset.
dataset_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
dataset_identityId :: Lens' Dataset (Maybe Text)

-- | Date on which the identity pool was last modified.
identityPoolUsage_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
identityPoolUsage_identityPoolId :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | Data storage information for the identity pool.
identityPoolUsage_dataStorage :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Integer)

-- | Number of sync sessions for the identity pool.
identityPoolUsage_syncSessionsCount :: Lens' IdentityPoolUsage (Maybe Integer)

-- | Date on which the identity was last modified.
identityUsage_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
identityUsage_identityPoolId :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | Number of datasets for the identity.
identityUsage_datasetCount :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Int)

-- | Total data storage for this identity.
identityUsage_dataStorage :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Integer)

-- | A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
identityUsage_identityId :: Lens' IdentityUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | List of SNS platform application ARNs that could be used by clients.
pushSync_applicationArns :: Lens' PushSync (Maybe [Text])

-- | A role configured to allow Cognito to call SNS on behalf of the
--   developer.
pushSync_roleArn :: Lens' PushSync (Maybe Text)

-- | The server sync count for this record.
record_syncCount :: Lens' Record (Maybe Integer)

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
record_deviceLastModifiedDate :: Lens' Record (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date on which the record was last modified.
record_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' Record (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value for the record.
record_value :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | The key for the record.
record_key :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | The user/device that made the last change to this record.
record_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' Record (Maybe Text)

-- | The last modified date of the client device.
recordPatch_deviceLastModifiedDate :: Lens' RecordPatch (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value associated with the record patch.
recordPatch_value :: Lens' RecordPatch (Maybe Text)

-- | An operation, either replace or remove.
recordPatch_op :: Lens' RecordPatch Operation

-- | The key associated with the record patch.
recordPatch_key :: Lens' RecordPatch Text

-- | Last known server sync count for this record. Set to 0 if unknown.
recordPatch_syncCount :: Lens' RecordPatch Integer


module Network.AWS.CognitoSync.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2014-06-30</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Cognito Sync
--   
--   Amazon Cognito Sync provides an AWS service and client library that
--   enable cross-device syncing of application-related user data.
--   High-level client libraries are available for both iOS and Android.
--   You can use these libraries to persist data locally so that it's
--   available even if the device is offline. Developer credentials don't
--   need to be stored on the mobile device to access the service. You can
--   use Amazon Cognito to obtain a normalized user ID and credentials.
--   User data is persisted in a dataset that can store up to 1 MB of
--   key-value pairs, and you can have up to 20 datasets per user identity.
--   
--   With Amazon Cognito Sync, the data stored for each identity is
--   accessible only to credentials assigned to that identity. In order to
--   use the Cognito Sync service, you need to make API calls using
--   credentials retrieved with <a>Amazon Cognito Identity service</a>.
--   
--   If you want to use Cognito Sync in an Android or iOS application, you
--   will probably want to make API calls via the AWS Mobile SDK. To learn
--   more, see the <a>Developer Guide for Android</a> and the <a>Developer
--   Guide for iOS</a>.
module Network.AWS.CognitoSync

-- | API version <tt>2014-06-30</tt> of the Amazon Cognito Sync SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Thrown when a request parameter does not comply with the associated
--   constraints.
_InvalidParameterException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown when a user is not authorized to access the requested resource.
_NotAuthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Indicates an internal service error.
_InternalErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Prism for InvalidConfigurationException' errors.
_InvalidConfigurationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An exception thrown when there is an IN_PROGRESS bulk publish
--   operation for the given identity pool.
_DuplicateRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS Lambda throttled your account, please contact AWS Support
_LambdaThrottledException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An exception thrown when a bulk publish operation is requested less
--   than 24 hours after a previous bulk publish operation completed
--   successfully.
_AlreadyStreamedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The AWS Lambda function returned invalid output or an exception.
_InvalidLambdaFunctionOutputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if the request is throttled.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if there are parallel requests to modify a resource.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if an update can't be applied because the resource was changed
--   by another call and this would result in a conflict.
_ResourceConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown if the resource doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Thrown when the limit on the number of objects or operations has been
--   exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A request for meta data about a dataset (creation date, number of
--   records, size) by owner and dataset name.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDataset</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDataset
DescribeDataset' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeDataset

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDataset</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:DescribeDataset'</a>,
--   <a>describeDataset_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:DescribeDataset'</a>,
--   <a>describeDataset_identityId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:DescribeDataset'</a>,
--   <a>describeDataset_datasetName</a> - A string of up to 128 characters.
--   Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash),
--   and '.' (dot).
newDescribeDataset :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeDataset

-- | Response to a successful DescribeDataset request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDatasetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDatasetResponse
DescribeDatasetResponse' :: Maybe Dataset -> Int -> DescribeDatasetResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDatasetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataset:DescribeDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDatasetResponse_dataset</a> - Meta data for a collection of
--   data for an identity. An identity can have multiple datasets. A
--   dataset can be general or associated with a particular entity in an
--   application (like a saved game). Datasets are automatically created if
--   they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up
--   to 1MB of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeDatasetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDatasetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeDatasetResponse :: Int -> DescribeDatasetResponse

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBulkPublishDetailsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse
GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BulkPublishStatus -> Int -> GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkPublishStartTime:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStartTime</a> - The
--   date/time at which the last bulk publish was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:GetBulkPublishDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced
--   GUID (for example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE)
--   created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkPublishCompleteTime:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishCompleteTime</a> - If
--   BulkPublishStatus is SUCCEEDED, the time the last bulk publish
--   operation completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureMessage:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_failureMessage</a> - If
--   BulkPublishStatus is FAILED this field will contain the error message
--   that caused the bulk publish to fail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkPublishStatus:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_bulkPublishStatus</a> - Status of the
--   last bulk publish operation, valid values are:
--   
--   NOT_STARTED - No bulk publish has been requested for this identity
--   pool
--   
--   IN_PROGRESS - Data is being published to the configured stream
--   
--   SUCCEEDED - All data for the identity pool has been published to the
--   configured stream
--   
--   FAILED - Some portion of the data has failed to publish, check
--   FailureMessage for the cause.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBulkPublishDetailsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetBulkPublishDetailsResponse :: Int -> GetBulkPublishDetailsResponse

--   automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset,

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeIdentityUsageResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityUsage:DescribeIdentityUsageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeIdentityUsageResponse_identityUsage</a> - Usage information
--   for the identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeIdentityUsageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeIdentityUsageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeIdentityUsageResponse :: Int -> DescribeIdentityUsageResponse

-- | A request to RegisterDevice.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterDevice</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterDevice
RegisterDevice' :: Text -> Text -> Platform -> Text -> RegisterDevice

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterDevice</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:RegisterDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerDevice_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for
--   example, us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by
--   Amazon Cognito. Here, the ID of the pool that the identity belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:RegisterDevice'</a>,
--   <a>registerDevice_identityId</a> - The unique ID for this identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:RegisterDevice'</a>, <a>registerDevice_platform</a> -
--   The SNS platform type (e.g. GCM, SDM, APNS, APNS_SANDBOX).
--   
--   <a>$sel:token:RegisterDevice'</a>, <a>registerDevice_token</a> - The
--   push token.
newRegisterDevice :: Text -> Text -> Platform -> Text -> RegisterDevice

--

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   this device by Cognito.

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RegisterDeviceResponse'</a>,

-- | A request for a list of records.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListRecords</a> smart constructor.
data ListRecords
ListRecords' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ListRecords

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRecords</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSyncCount:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecords_lastSyncCount</a> - The last server sync count for this
--   record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_nextToken</a> - A
--   pagination token for obtaining the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncSessionToken:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecords_syncSessionToken</a> - A token containing a session ID,
--   identity ID, and expiration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of results to be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityPoolId:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecords_identityPoolId</a> - A name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityId:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_identityId</a> - A
--   name-spaced GUID (for example,
--   us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon
--   Cognito. GUID generation is unique within a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetName:ListRecords'</a>, <a>listRecords_datasetName</a> -
--   A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z,
--   0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).
newListRecords :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ListRecords

-- | Returned for a successful ListRecordsRequest.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListRecordsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListRecordsResponse
ListRecordsResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Record] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Int -> ListRecordsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRecordsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetDeletedAfterRequestedSyncCount:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_datasetDeletedAfterRequestedSyncCount</a> - A
--   boolean value specifying whether to delete the dataset locally.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetExists:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_datasetExists</a> - Indicates whether the
--   dataset exists.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_count</a> - Total number of records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:records:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_records</a> - A list of all records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_nextToken</a> - A pagination token for
--   obtaining the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mergedDatasetNames:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_mergedDatasetNames</a> - Names of merged
--   datasets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:syncSessionToken:ListRecords'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_syncSessionToken</a> - A token containing a
--   session ID, identity ID, and expiration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_lastModifiedBy</a> - The user/device that made
--   the last change to this record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datasetSyncCount:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_datasetSyncCount</a> - Server sync count for
--   this dataset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListRecordsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRecordsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListRecordsResponse :: Int -> ListRecordsResponse
